oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farmer's Friend Manufacturing Company Catalog
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Grain industry; Agricultural machinery & implements; Drilling & boring machinery; Fertilizers
Agriculture; Commercial catalogs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Original printed pink wrappers with illustrated front wrap. Rear wrapper has illustrations of the manufacturer's factory, several drills produced by the manufacturer, and medals won at various exhibitions. Black and white illustrations throughout.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Farmers Friend Manufacturing Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The catalog advertised a new type of farm implement used in planting grain and spreading newly developed chemical fertilizers. Before the Civil War about 75-90 labor-hours were required to produce 100 bushels of corn (2-1/2 acres) with walking plow, harrow, and hand planting. By 1870, an expanded market demand for agricultural products brought adoption of improved technology and resulting increases in farm production.
